intro: Crossostoma spinescens, commonly known as the spiny crossostoma, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine habitats. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often sparsely branched. The flowers, which bloom in summer, are typically blue or violet in color and attract various pollinators.
